reviews:
I am into the whole Everyday Carry thing and I like to carry everything I need everyday while keeping it minimal.

I obsessively spent countless hours researching for the smallest, best, coolest, keychain light out there. All of my research kept pointing towards the NiteCore Tube. This is a great addition to my keyring.

The slim profile allows me to add it to my keyring without compromising the entirety of my Everday Carry. It is a rechargeable (micro-USB) and has two modes of light (dim and bright). The dim option is good when you're in absolute darkness. However, the bright option is really bright! I use it outdoors and it illuminates everything in front of me.

BATTERY: This thing is absolutely great on battery. Considering that I use this flashlight quite regularly, I have only had to charge it twice, and that's just to top up the juice. It has an incredible standby battery life that after owning it for a month, that I've only proactively charged it.

If you're looking for a really bright slim, low-profile rechargeable keychain flashlight that weighs almost nothing, this is the product for you. I spent hours researching so you don't have to. I recommend this product. If I was able to help you make your decision, let me know by saying it was Helpful!

review_title: The BEST overall keychain light I have ever owned!
reviews:
This is my 5th NiteCore Tube. I have loved owning quality flashlights over the years and have always yearned for a VERY long standby battery life with Very durable shell and bright enough for camping, walking and reading when necessary. Just over $10 Canadian this light has a poly-carbonate shell (practically indestructible and pocket with keys approved!) It has 2 default modes (low and high) as well as the ability to adjust the brightness infinitely. The most important aspect is the ability for the light to stay OFF under all circumstances. There is a lockout mode that does just that! At just 9 grams of weight - this thing is AMAZINGLY light and provides a surprisingly large amount of light output for it's size. 45 minutes on max brightness is easily achievable (without burning your hand) and even as the light ages past 2 years and 24+ hrs on low for an all-night nightlight when camping.
If you are looking for the bragging rights for the brightest light in the world - there is brighter available - however I would put this light up against lights costing 4X as much in the same size class. We have used this on Drones, Frisbees and even as a carabiner for your zipper on your jacket. If I had a reason - I would buy even more.

review_title: Avoid the knock-offs, get the real thing.
reviews:
There are knock-offs and this is not it.

This is a very good light for attaching to your keychain. Multiple light levels with easy access to the dimmest (one-click) and the brightest (double-click). Battery lasts a good amount of time and easily charges with the micro-USB socket in the side.

Its well built and sturdy for its size. It doesn't flex when bending and has a proper metal tab for hooking into your keychain. I got the clear version as I like being able to see all the electronics.

My favourite part is that it doesn't have the stupid lighting modes that many flashlight manufactures 'throw-in'. Think SOS and strobe mode. Why?

reviews:
I used a mini flashlight hanging on my keychain for a long time. The flashlight was barely adequate for my needs and the twist activation annoyed the piss out of me. The Nitecore tube is a great little keychain - it's about the size of a house key and weighs much less than an average flashlight. (No, I don't have a jewelry scale to measure...) This keychain light has four modes - momentary on (45 lumens), low (1 lumen), high (45 lumens), and step up.

The low mode is perfect for nighttime raids on the bathroom or for finding stuff in a dark purse. The momentary on (45 lumens) is seriously bright enough to left after images on my eyes for about 10 minutes.

I've left the flashlight on high and it only noticeably dims after 45 minutes. Pretty good for a flashlight that's always being carried.

I find that I'm using this flashlight every day. Being rechargeable means that I can flaff about with the batteries without it failing.

The only niggle I have with this product is that the usb cover feels flimsy and is hard to get out of the slot. Use a fingernail to pry it open or a sharp/flat object.

reviews:
I'm genuinely surprised as to how small and light this flashlight is. It's the size of a house key being about 2 inches in length. Being USB rechargeable is another great plus for this flashlight. Also at 45 lumens, this keychain flashlight is bright enough to light up your dark room and is enough light for close up tasks and for searching for those items in between furniture. The 1 lumen mode is perfect for preserving dark-adapted vision. I believe this is a must have flashlight for everyone as you can't go wrong with its size. It will save your phone's battery along with providing you with a brighter and more reliable light than that of your smartphone's. It also makes a great back-up light for those who are already carrying a larger 18650 EDC flashlight since it will always be on your keys when you leave home.

The Nitecore Tube does not come with the Micro USB cable to charge it, however since it is a common cable, the exclusion of it probably was done to lower costs.

Pros:
Keychain-friendly
Very Small and Lightweight
Bright for its size
USB rechargeable
Adjustable Brightness

Cons:
Does not include Micro USB Cable.

reviews:
It's small, light, keychainable in a pinch. Is it worth it? In a word: no.

1. It runs off a non-replaceable Li-ion battery. Battery goes dead? The whole thing needs to be replaced. This whole Apple-esque philosophy needs to go.
2. The rubber flap covering the micro-USB charging port often gets in the way and doesn't like being put back into its place. Besides offering *no* actual protection against water damage!

I've actually gone back to my last-surviving LRI Photonlight (red with covert housing) after killing this Tube with a trip to the washer. Replace the CR2032 on the Photonlight and it works again! Way better than this.

reviews:
The size is right - not too large to be a nuisance on your key ring. The materials (polycarbonate) and construction are good. The button works well and the micro USB charging port is well sealed from dirt/moisture. A blue LED shows charging and goes out when complete. There several useful modes for the light and thankfully, the now seemingly mandatory SOS and strobe are not included! Press and hold for the 45 lumen mode. Press & release once for the low 1 lumen mode which is nice for looking for a keyhole or in movie theater (won't disturb anyone with a blast of light). Two presses is standard 45 lumens, press once and release and press and hold for variable output - interesting but not something I use. And the very useful press once - wait a couple of seconds and press and hold for 4 seconds - it will flash once and turn off. This locks the light from accidentally being turned on while in your pocket etc. To unlock, press and hold the button for 4 seconds - the light will turn in at 45 lumen level. Nothing worse than thinking you have a light to only find its discharged/dead!

Watch for fakes! The fakes have small batteries and lack the IP65 water resistance.

review_title: Durable, portable and extremely bright 45 Lumen option!
reviews:
Very small and portable keychain light. I was surprised at how small it was, and it's a perfect little tool to have on a keychain. The 45 Lumen light option is extremely bright. From my experience, the battery life with the 45 Lumen option is about 30-45 minutes. On the regular brightness mode, the battery life is a lot longer. It also has a convenient micro-USB port for charging on the side that is protected by a cover. Other reviewers have noted that the cover is a bit hard to get open, but I have had no problems opening it so far. It is also very durable, as I have dropped it a few times and haven't noticed any scratches or scuff marks. There is no charging cable included, so please keep note of that before you buy it. For the price of this light, you can't go wrong.

What's good about this product?
☑ Small and portable.
☑ Durable.
☑ Affordable.
☑ Extremely bright when on the 45-Lumen option.
☑ Very large beam of brightness.
☑ Good and consistent battery life.
☑ Rechargeable with microUSB.
☑ 3 different lighting modes (normal brightness, 45 Lumen and one that starts dim and goes bright repeatedly.)

What's bad about this product?
⚠ Some reviewers have noted the little rubber flap that allows access to the microUSB port is a little tough to open, but I have had no problems.
⚠ No charging cable included, but this is an extremely common cable.

review_title: Great EDC flashlight, better than button cell lights smaller than AAA aluminium keychain flashlights
reviews: I was using a small button cell flashlight which is very compact but was a pain because of cost and availability of button cells, and run time of the light. I am usually around USB cables and charging devices that can charge this without issue 95% of the time. It has a very long run time on low and 45 lumens seemed bright enough for my everyday needs. When I got it I charged it up via my laptop and micro USB cable, it took about 20 minutes. Low setting is about as bright as a tealight, with enough light in a dark room to see what is directly around me, high is quite bright and good enough for most everyday tasks like walking in the dark or looking under a piece of furniture. I was so impressed with the size and light output I bought two more right away. The only thing that would make it better would be if it had a flashing mode so that I could use it at night as a visibility aid when crossing streets etc., but I figure I can just turn it on and swing it around to catch drivers attention. For most people this will be perfect for their keychain or purse and costs less than most of the good quality aluminum lights. It feels sturdy enough to survive in a pocket or purse with keys and the on off switch is is designed so that it will not easily turn on accidently in your pocket or purse.

review_title: Just the right flashlight as gift
reviews:
The NiteCore Tube Keychain Light didn't have the 'normal' design as one expected from most regular keychain lights. No IPX8, aluminum Alloy body, tactical or head twisting switch etc.

I ordered one just for fun thinking that was just an advanced version of those corporate gift keychain lights. While I failed to give away my regular AAA keychain lights to family members and relatives, I didn't have any problems with this one.

They liked it because they felt comfortable with the USB charging (similar to their phones and tablets), no head twisting to power it on or off, lightweight and compact in design.

Once I demonstrated its continuous mode, it became a fun gadget to play with. I had to order more since no one is refusing to accept as a gift anymore.

reviews:
At its maximum setting, it's noticeably than the usual button-cell keychain light. The low setting is too dim for any help unless you're in nearly complete darkness. USB charging is a big plus. For the curious, the flashlight is 5.5 cm long, which is right around the length of a generic key.

Pros:
- pretty bright at maximum
- adjustable brightness
- rechargeable

Cons:
- no charging cable included
- the little (rather bright) LED on the inside that turns on while charging is blue-UV, meaning it's harmful for your retina. It's annoying if you charge it by laptop, but you can just put it somewhere you can't see it. Would much rather have seen a red LED for charging.

Photos are of the black version.
product_name: NiteCore Tube Keychain Light T Series 45 Lumen Multi Color Pocket Flashlight
rank:
#20,482 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement)
#216 in Handheld Flashlights

review_title: A good mini key chain led flash light.
reviews:
Good key chain L.E.D. flash light. NiteCore products up to North American standards. This is an update on this product many months down the road. I've since purchased 8-10 of these quality lights. I use these daily, about 4-5 times mininum. I have one on every keychain I own.
I own all the colors except "pink." (There is a possibility I puchased a pink one for my spouse) My first one, and my go to one that I've been field testing, is clear in the casing.

Not once has it failed me except for using it on "high" lumen output, and after about 40-50 minutes it was starting to dim. Then I switched to another one, and while working on a furnace, did the same thing.
Just recharged the Li-ion battery and carried on. Watch the pricing, it is totally all over the place for the exact same item.

I first discovered NiteCore with their battery chargers. Usually words that ryme with "kina" means low quality, junk. NiteCore helps to dispel that when it comes to chargers and this L.E.D. keychain light. On low lumen output it keeps on going. I have yet to have it let me down or dim on low.

I work shifts and are up at all times, and use it as not to disturb "others" as I move about. The low kicks out enough lumen (candle power) as not to bump into things while moving around the house, but isn't brite enough to disturb my "others." But when you want the extra juice, your choice, bump it up to high, or anywhere in between.

It's a winner, folks.
product_name: NiteCore Tube Keychain Light T Series 45 Lumen Multi Color Pocket Flashlight
rank:
#20,482 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement)
#216 in Handheld Flashlights

reviews:
Bright for a keychain light, pretty long battery life, rechargable, almost never turns on by accident sitting in my pocket. Only thing is its not waterproof.

UPDATE:

4 months of use of this little thing, and it gave out.
For the price I paid, I would say it was worth it. It was very handy and served me well, sitting on my keychain. However, I have not located the reason why it ceased to function. Came home one day to a non-functional light, and assumed a dead battery. Charged to no avail.

Still a decent product, but this makes me question it's durability in the long term.

review_title: Worked for one charge then died forever.
reviews:
I guess there is a reason that this one costs about five times less than most of Nitecore's other ones. Mine worked for one charge and now it just glows bright blue and never charges at all. I didn't get mine from Amazon and apparently there's no usable warranty from the maker at all (and yes, it's a real one, not a fake) - So it's been a waste of money and time for me.

I'd suggest you make sure yours charges properly within the Amazon warranty return period, because there's nothing you can do at all once that's over.

Hopefully somebody finds this helpful!

reviews:
Very useful when in the darkness. The plastic is fairly sturdy.
I like how the product has removable screws. This means that we could disassemble the product to repair if necessary without destroying the light.

There is a lockout feature that is not mentioned on the packaging at all.
To lock; turn on the light, wait 3 seconds, then press and hold the button for 3 seconds until the light flashes once from the off state.
To unlock; press and hold the power button for 3 seconds.

I dislike the colour temperature a lot. It is far too blue.

reviews: What makes a perfect flashlight? It's bright, it lasts a long time, it's light and compact so it's there in your pocket when you need it... this li'l gem has all of those, plus it recharges on a USB cable. What's not to like?!? Ok, it's not as bright as a Cree/T6, and it doesn't focus, but it's in your pocket when the power goes out on a dark and stormy night. This is the light you use to find your bigger badder flashlight in a drawer somewhere, in the dark. (I do suggest avoiding the black one, so you can see the blue "recharge" indicator thru the case.)

The case got really hot and then after 15 minutes it shut off by itself and was fine and worked normally. I saw on the internet that this happened to one other person as well and it was not even cold outside for them so the temperature outside was not the cause of it doing that.

The battery does last for an incredibly long time. I think I only remember charging it once or twice in the time that I have owned this.

reviews:
This is a review I am disappointed to write as I had high hopes for the product. Sadly the charging port cover broke off. It is clearly very flimsy, hardly fit for purpose. Disappointing as USB charging is a USP feature for peeps who are not keen on button cell replacement.

Its particularly disappointing because the UI and the lighting specification is excellent, particularly the one click to 1 Lumen which is perfectly adequate to illuminate a key-hole or door. There is always a concern (expressed in other reviews) that a single click to On might result in inadvertent activation in the pocket. To counter that there is a lockout function, from On press for 3 seconds. That works - EXCEPT - the 3 second press to unlock results in the 45 Lumen output. A stupid (or lazy) designer oversight.

So its back to this  Nite Ize Radiant Squeeze Light LED Key Chain Light - Black, N/A  This product's USP is that illumination is momentary so inadvertent full discharge is unlikely.

I also have this excellent simple flashlight ...  Olight® i3E EOS Tiny EDC LED Keyring Torch(Silver 120 lumens,other colors are 90 lumens) AAA EDC Flash Light Compact Keychain Flashlight Updated Version of Olight i3S Key Ring Torches Light(Black,Silver,Green,Red,Purple,Blue 6 Colors for Your Choice)Black

review_title: Excellent torch, battery doesn’t last as long as advertised
reviews:
Excellent little good quality keyring torch with a long battery life and plastic case so it doesn’t get covered in scratches or damage other items on your keyring or in your pocket.
The two modes are excellent it’s a well thought out design that exceeds expectations in all aspects except one. The packaging states that in low power mode the torch will run for 48 hours, I decided to test this and fully charged the torch, then put it into low power mode on my bedside table at normal room temperature, after 14 hours the torch was still going strong, however when I returned from work 22 hours after initially turning the torch was off and the battery needed charging. I am pleased with the torch and expected to be impressed that it had lasted 2 days. However this is still an excellent little torch.

review_title: Hätte ein tolles Produkt sein können...
reviews:
Hätte ein tolles Produkt sein können, aber...
Vorweg, ich besitze eine Menge Produkte von Nitecore und bin von der Qualität des Herstellers überzeugt. Angefangen bei unterschiedlichen Chargern, über Akkus bis hin zu jeder Taschenlampe der Tiny Monster 26 Reihe.
Die Tube ist für den Schlüsselbund super. Handlich, eine unkomplizierte Bedienung und in orange hilft sie sogar tagsüber durch die leuchtende Farbe schnell den Schlüsselbund zu finden.
Nun das ABER. Sie geht schnell kaputt.
Das erste Modell hatte ich in transparent. Nach einem Jahr und 5 bis 7 Akkuladungen ging nichts mehr. Ein Druck auf den Knopf und die Lampe blieb aus. Dachte erst sie wäre leer also an das Ladekabel angeschlossen, Lade– LED ging an alles wie gewohnt.
Nach mehreren Stunden leuchtete die Lade LED immer noch und nach dem abstecken und einschalten – nichts.
Naja, kann ja mal passieren und kostet nicht die Welt also bei der nächsten Bestellung wieder eine mitbestellt.
Die hielt ein halbes Jahr, dann der selbe Defekt. Dieses Mal hab ich reklamiert und problemlos Ersatz bekommen. Doch mit der kam es erst gar nicht zum zweiten aufladen, sie ging schon früher mit ebenfalls dem selben Fehler kaputt.
Sehr enttäuschend, drei von drei defekt mit dem selben Fehlerbild. Verstehe nicht wie man über Jahre ein Produkt mit solchen Qualitätsproblemen vertreiben kann.
product_name: NiteCore Tube Keychain Light T Series 45 Lumen Multi Color Pocket Flashlight
rank:
#20,482 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement)
#216 in Handheld Flashlights

reviews:
Muy práctica, en baja alumbra lo suficiente para caminar en oscuridad total o leer algo, y en alta lo suficiente para buscar algo o iluminar algo que estés haciendo.

Lo bueno: muy comoda, resiste lluvia ligera y que sea recargable es una gran ventaja contra otras mini lamparas, no estorba y no pesa, ilumina bien (como un celular pero más focalizado) en alta y bien en baja sin molestar a los demas o si requieres usarla constantemente mucho tiempo.

Lo malo: compré tres, la primera vino abierta (o cerrada pero con diurex) y no servía, despues llegaron otras dos de las cuales una duró como tres días antes de fallar; es decir de tres lamparas solo sirvió una.

Si te gusta meter mano a las cosas no te preocupes, es el cable del positivo que no viene bien sueldado a la placa y sa desconecta; lo sueldas y listo, ya funciona bien. A mi me gustó, la traigo siempre conmigo.
product_name: NiteCore Tube Keychain Light T Series 45 Lumen Multi Color Pocket Flashlight
rank:

#216 in Handheld Flashlights

reviews:
Zu Beginn möchte ich schreiben das die Lampe im ersten Eindruck und nach ein paar Mal benutzen nicht schlecht ist und ihren Dienst tut daran kann man eigentlich nichts aussetzen wenn sie wieder erwarten kaputt gehen würde wie schon manche in anderen Rezensionen geschrieben haben werde ich noch einen Nachtrag schreiben.

Aber was mal garnicht geht sind die Produktbilder. Mir gefiel die Lampe auf dem Produktbild sehr aber leider weicht die tatsächliche Farbe von dem Produktbild extrem ab. Also wenn ihr überlegt diese Farbe zu kaufen dann möchte ich euch die Farbe kurz umschreiben und zwar ist die tatsächliche Farbe NEON ORANGE also sehr "grell" und für meinen Geschmack zu "neon" ;) aber naja bevor ich sie zurückschicke werde ich sie behalten das sie ja funktioniert.

Trotzdem gebe ich 3 Sterne obwohl für mich die Farbe schon wichtig war/ist aber 2 Sterne wären nicht gerechtfertigt da sie wie gesagt ja funktioniert.

review_title: Pudo ser muy buena, pero es frágil.

1 día en el Edc fue suficiente para acabar con la lámpara. Pensé que era por que la había usado casi 1 hora en modo de alta intensidad... Pero tras cargarla de un puerto USB de laptop, no funciona el Led... El sistema de carga indica con una luz de color azul un funcionamiento del sistema que carga la batería, pero no...

Fue una buena compañera mientras duró. La vieja y confiable minimaglite AAA volverá al Edc este próximo día.

Una pena.

reviews:
Wow hammer geil die kleine led Lampe, hatte ich nicht erwartet das eine led aus den ersten Generationen noch so leistungsfähige und stark sein kann für diese Größe echt wow!
Im 1 Lumen , Spar Modus leuchtet sie etwas 1 bis 2 m weit und das laut Hersteller für etwa 48 Stunden! Respekt!
Im Power Modus reicht der Akku nur für etwa 1 Stunde aber dafür leuchtet sie fast 25 bis 30 m weit das ist für die winzige Größe echt wow!
Die einschalt taste verfügt über mehrere Moduse wie eco,Power,dimmen von eco auf Power stufenlos und gedrückt halten mit Power Modus um solange man drückt Licht zu haben läßt man los Licht aus einfach und praktisch!
Der Akku lädt in etwa einer Stunde voll auf bei mir zumindest!
Sie ist Hervorragend verarbeitet und der Micro USB ist einfach und praktisch geschützt!
Verbesserungs vorschlag an den Hersteller eine stärkere version wäre interessant?!
Mfg K.O .

review_title: Bright and light rechargeable keyring LED
reviews:
Very light, surprisingly small and (at full brightness) very bright. The default dim setting is extremely dim, which will either be useful (it's great for not waking people up at night) or frustrating, depending on your usage. But double-click the on button (or press and hold from off) and you get full brightness, which is amazingly bright for a keychain LED. There's also a useful lock function for travelling.

The plastic shell, which is hard and glossy, looks pretty cheap (a matte of soft-touch finish would have much nicer). I'd guess the USB connector rubber cap won't last that long either. But as an economical, rechargeable and bright keyring LED, I'm pretty happy with it.

review_title: Lampe porte clé USB NITECORE Tube
reviews:
Cette petite lampe porte-clés USB a tout d'une grande !
Elle mesure 5,3cm de long pour 2 cm de large et 8 mm d'épaisseur. Elle ne pèse que quelques grammes.

Sa LED blanche permet un double éclairage de 45 lumens en mode pleine puissance et 1 lumen en mode minimum.
Un premier clic sur le contacteur (gainé de caoutchouc) vous permet d'aviver le mode basse consommation, un second clic active le mode pleine puissance. Enfin, un dernier clic éteint la la diode.
Vous trouverez un petit anneau en métal qui vous permettra d'y passer une cordelette ou un anneau porte-clés.

Dans les faits, cette lampe est si légère et compacte qu'elle se fait oublier dans votre poche, sac ou sur votre trousseau.
Vous l'aurez ainsi toujours avec vous, ce qui n'est pas forcément le cas d'une lampe plus volumineuse.

L'éclairage en mode 1 lm est parfait pour se déplacer la nuit chez vous sans réveiller toute votre famille.
Le mode 45 lm est étonnamment puissant et permet d'éclairer sans difficulté l'intégralité d'une pièce de 10 à 12 m2 (portée annoncée 24m).

Gros avantage, elle se recharge grâce à un cordon de type micro USB.
Vous n'aurez donc pas à vous soucier de votre consommation en piles comme c'était le cas avec les célèbres lampes-boutons de marque Photon.
Vous pourrez ainsi la brancher sur votre PC / Mac ou sur secteur en utilisant le cordon de votre smartphone (non fourni).
La recharge sur secteur est très rapide, le témoin de charge (diode principale en mode éco, cf photo) s'éteint quand la batterie est pleine.

Elle est très résistante, normée IPX8 = IP65.
J'ai acheté plusieurs de ces lampes tant je les trouve pratiques. Je porte une des miennes en poche tous les jours, je l'ai faite tomber un nombre incalculable de fois et elle fonctionne toujours aussi bien.

Seul bémol, l'interrupteur, bien que ne dépassant que très peu du châssis de la lampe, a tendance à allumer la lampe quand vous la portez en poche avec un autre objet. L'autonomie en mode 1 lm étant de 48h, vous aurez le temps de vous enregistrer Endre compte avant d'avoir épuisé la batterie.
Dernièrement, j'en ai fixée une sur un drone Parrot. Elle ne pèse presque rien et permet cependant un éclairage conséquent.

Vous l'aurez compris, je vous recommande vivement cet objet, que ce soit pour la camping, la randonnée, le bricolage ou la vie de tous les jours. Vous l'oublierez sur votre trousseau de clé jusqu'au moment où vous en aurez besoin pour palier à une panne de courant, chercher dans votre sac ou vous rassurer dans un escalier lugubre.

review_title: ちょい使いには申し分無し。
reviews:
子供用に購入、主に学童ルームの帰りに暗い道用で。
ランドセルのリールキーホルダーに付けてます。
今までは100均のLEDライト７灯タイプ(小さく軽かった)をぶら下げてましたがとうとう壊れてしまい、家にあった小さいSUREFIREモドキを使わせてました。
しかし重いためリールが伸びっぱなしになるし、ゴツいので防犯ブザーと一緒にぶら下げると邪魔になる。
(他にも防犯ホイッスルとかもぶら下がってるので…(^_^;))
で、小さく軽いこちらに変えました。
HIGHモードで45ルーメン、LOWモードで1ルーメンとありますが、LOWモードでも夕方なら足元照らすには問題ない明るさでした。
何より小さく軽いので娘も気に入ってくれました、しかも防水IP65だし。
但し値段の割には、ちょっと安っぽい見た目です…黄色はf(^_^;
あとは充電式なのでバッテリー切れに気を付けたいと思います。
product_name: NiteCore Tube Keychain Light T Series 45 Lumen Multi Color Pocket Flashlight
rank:
#20,482 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement)
#216 in Handheld Flashlights

reviews:
Gleich vorweg: ich bin so ein kleiner Taschenlampen-Freak (wie viele Männer) :)

Bisher war meine immer dabei Lampe eine kleine Photon Micro Lampe, die zwar ihren angedachten Zweck immer erfüllt hat, aber mittlerweile in die Jahre gekommen ist und einen sehr großen Nachteil aufweist: Batterien (CR2016), die zwar heutzutage nicht mehr so teuer sind, aber dennoch regelmäßig gewechselt werden mussten.

Das gehört mit der Nitecore Tube endlich der Vergangenheit an. Falls die Nitecore Tube schlappmacht, genügt ein Micro USB Kabel samt Stromquelle und der Akku ist binnen 1-2 h wieder voll geladen.
Darüber hinaus ist die Lampe auch sehr hell (gemessen an ihrer Größe) und nicht zu spotlastig, sodass eine größere Fläche gut ausgeleuchtet werden kann. Das Licht würde ich als neutral weiß bezeichnen, aber nicht kalt, was mir sehr entgegenkommt.

Die Bedienung ist narrensicher: einmal Drücken des oben sitzenden Knopfs und die Lampe erstrahlt in schwachem Licht, kurz darauf noch einmal gedrückt und die Lampe strahlt auf hellster Stufe. Das kommt mir sehr entgegen.
Hält man direkt nach dem Einschalten (einmaliges Drücken und kurz Loslassen) den Knopf gedrückt, kann man die Lampe sogar stufenlos dimmen (wer's braucht?).

Aufgrund der kleinen Größe ist das jetzt meine "Immer dabei" Lampe, die mich hoffentlich eine Zeit lang begleiten wird.

Tipp am Rande: drückt man im eingeschalteten (!) Zustand den Knopf für ca. 3-5 Sekunden, sperrt man die Taschenlampe. Die Lampe quittiert dieses 'Lockout' mit einem einmaligen sehr hellen Blinken und ist danach sozusagen tot (da gesperrt!).
Durch erneutes längeres Drücken des Buttons kann man die Lampe wieder zum Leben erwecken (Entsprerren). Das steht zwar alles auf der Rückseite der Verpackung, aber anscheinend treten doch viele Leute in diese Falle (zumindest wenn man auf Amazon.com die englischsprachigen Reviews liest).
Kaputt dürfte die Tube in den meisten Fällen dann aber wohl doch nicht sein, sondern per Design einfach nur gelockt (wobei ich natürlich nicht ausschließen will, dass die Lampe bei dem ein oder anderen User nicht doch eine Fehlfunktion aufgewiesen hat -> Langzeiterfahrungen habe ich nämlich noch nicht).

review_title: 室内着への装着で便利
reviews:
夜トイレに行く時や、夜室内着でちょと外に出る時や、停電時の備えとして　最初、室内着のチャックの持ち手箇所に「GENTOS GK-003RW」を取り付けていましたが、こちらのほうが、防水になっており、色もオレンジでカッコよく　こちらに取り替えました。
使い勝手としては、GENTOSが１クリッックで明るい状態になるに対し、
こちらは１回目のクリックで暗く、２回めで明るくなるのですが、
自分の使い方では、明るい方のみを使いますので１回目のクリックで明るくなるGENTOSの方が使いやすかったです。
一般的にキーホルダとして至近距離で使う場合には、暗い方で十分であり電池の持ちも長くなる為　1クリック目が暗い方が良いのかもしれません。

review_title: 暗闇で至近距離の文字を読むために購入
reviews:
暗い場所、打ち合わせ用の紙資料有りの環境でHiなら文字は問題なく読めます。
真っ暗闇の中の物の有無程度はLoでいけます。

UI的には軽く練習すれば基本的なところは問題ないと思います。
ロックアウトしてしまえば誤爆もないです。

一応お試しでHiで連続点灯させて見ました。暗くなりつつ一時間超えても点いてます。
45分は実用上の明るさがキープできるランタイムなんでしょうねぇ。
とりあえず45分が確認できたのでテストは終了。

他に照明器具（懐中電灯やヘッドランプ）が無い環境で使う分には申し分なし。
主力ではさすがに使えないものの、鍵束と一緒にしておいてのとっさの明かりには十分すぎですね。

単4とかボタン電池とかのキーライトのリプレイスなら重量面でこちらの方が有利かと思います。
電池交換が不要な点も有利。
いつ使うのか判らない物の電池交換とか面倒極まりなく、TUBEなら「充電済みを持ち歩いて、使用したら充電」の心がけで問題ない上に、そこらのスマホの充電コネクターで充電可能ですから。

ロックアウトした状態からスタート（長押し実測3.5秒）すればHiでスタートします。
OFFにするときもロックアウト（長押し実測3.9秒）させちゃえば、ボタン長押し一回で済むので、こっちの方が実用的かも。

通常時（スタンバイ）からだと、1ルーメンを経由しないと調光モードもHiにもできないので、ちょっと手間かも。
使用状況に左右されるので使い分けが肝要。

追記
購入後3週間目に、誤って洗濯機に投入ｗ
出したばかりの時は充電中のような光を発していたので乾かす為にコネクターのラバーを開放して放置。
しばらくしたら消えていたので、使用して見ると普通に使えました。
案外タフですね。

review_title: Very nice light; ONE FATAL FLAW
reviews:
I've had 3 of these lights now, one from a couple years ago that mysteriously stopped working despite the charging port still indicating it was charging and two more which quit working recently.

I decided to tear down my two most recent ones at the same time and noticed they both had the same issue with the positive connections coming free from the board. I was able to fix one of these by reflowing the solder, but the oldest one appears to have discharged itself into oblivion.

The positive solder connection sits between the case and the board, so flexing from normal use will always kill the device after being in your pocket for long enough.

Long story short: buy it if you need something to throw in your bag. Don't bother if you intend to use it on your key ring.

reviews:
This is a great keychain flashlight when it works, but unfortunately they only last for a few months and then break. After about 5 months of light use mine no longer turns on at all and no longer charges. The charging indicator lights up showing that the battery is being charged, but no amount of button pushes will get it to turn on no matter how long it is charged.

To make matters worse, Nitecore does NOT honor their "lifetime" warranty at all. After making me send them my receipt multiple times and send them a video showing that the keychain is broken they told me that I would have to pay the full cost of shipping the item to China and back for repair. Something that would cost more than just buying a brand new flashlight.

Save yourself the headache and don't buy this. The 5-star reviews are from people who just bought the flashlight and haven't owned/used it long enough to have it fail.

review_title: Not only do I recommend it highly, but I would also suggest buying several.
reviews:
➤ Specifications
• Max Output: 45 lumens
• Max Beam Distance: 24 m
• Max Beam Intensity: 150 cd
• Max Run time: 48 h 0 m / 2 d
• Battery: Rechargeable Li-ion
• Beam color: White light
• Beam angle: Up to 100°

• Length: 56.5 mm / 2.22 in
• Head Size: 21 mm / 0.83 in
• Weight: 9.6 g / 0.34 oz

➤ Features
• One click: Low mode. 1 lumen, for 48 hours.
• Double click: High mode. 45 lumens for 1 hour.
• Double click, holding down the second click: Infinitely Variable Brightness. Hold to reach your desired light output.
• USB rechargeable, rubber cover for Micro USB slot, rubber button, 11mm and 20mm split rings.

• It does not come with a micro USB cord for charging, though it will work with any.
• While charging, a blue light will emits from within the flashlight. It will turn off once it has been fully charged.
• While charging, you cannot turn the light on.
• No momentary function. You have to fully click it, or keep the button pressed to turn it on.
• Charging takes about an hour from fully discharged to fully charged, and this will vary, depending on the discharge level.
• At high mode (45 lumens), it will dim after about 50 minutes of constant use. You have about ten minutes left before it dims to 1-2 lumens. Recharging would be advisable.
• There is no safety to prevent it from turning on, and because the button is raised from the body, it may turn on involuntary.

➤ Thoughts
I love it. It is so small I don't feel it on my keychain. It is powerful enough to navigate a dark street or find something in a pitch black room, yet it also has a low mode for tasks that do not require much light, like reading a note, finding a keyhole, looking into a bag etc. I love the low mode, since it does not drain the battery and is bright enough for many tasks. The infinitely variable brightness is a nice touch.
It also comes with two keyrings, and most importantly, it is USB rechargeable. No need to buy those expensive and rare watch batteries. Just plug it in a USB, wait an hour, and you're good to go.
Not only do I recommend it highly, but I would also suggest buying several. Give one to all your loved ones, keep them in packs and kits, use them as zipper pulls, hand them out as gifts. They are very well-made, durable, very bright, small enough to go on your keys, and just very hand to have. Great product, at a great price.
Maybe Nitecore will release a steel casing version, for increased durability. That would be nice too.

➤ Photos
• Disassembled unit.
• Size comparison: AA battery, Gerber Shard, Key-Bak, Nite Ize QuicKey, Namann Key pocket knife, Nitecore Tube, Gerber Dime.

review_title: I take it with me wherever i go !
reviews:
it is just incredible how such a little light can be so efficient and well made. the body is made from polycarbonate materials so it is impact resistant approved and there are videos of this light on youtube testing it on a hardcore level of running it over with a jeep and the thing still works, the adjustable lumen feature is very cool , going from 1 to 45 lumens so you can see perfectly in front of you i'd say about 5-6 meters which is incredible for just a little keychain light. the button is solid and stays in place without any shaking.the battery type is li-on and the charging system is awesome, you do not have to worry about overcharging it or voltage unbalances because it has a intelligent protection charging system which is USB guys! (the charging cord is the same of a usb samsung cell phone so you can find it anywhere and at a low cost)how cool is that ? guys like me who travel a lot abroad i don't have to worry about 110V,220V,230V and BS like that, i just plug it in to my portable pc and it's done charging in less than an hour.I have had this flashlight for about 2 months now and all i can say is that it is a great product and many great compliments to nitecore on this one.
P.S
it is very important that you know what purpose you need a flashlight for ,then you choose which suits you best . don't just go for the most convenient and think that it will do the job for every situation. hunting,fishing,personal defence,EDC,keychain,bike riding,hiking,inspection,spotting ecc.... each of these activities requires different types of flashlights most of the the time . thankyou for reading have a good one.

review_title: This light is great! Has one small issue.
reviews:
I was pleasantly surprised by this light. It was much better than I expected. The light output is very bright for it's small size on the brightest setting. I am impressed that they got this much light out of a standard 5mm LED. The low brightness setting isn't too useful, but it's nice to have. The rechargeable battery is the best part, it doesn't come with a cable but will work with any micro USB cable. Mine came fully discharged, and needed to be charged for about an hour. The charging indicator is bright and shines through the LED a little bit. It's also smaller than it appears in the picture, this is actually a good thing, as I thought it would be too bulky for my keychain. It fits very nicely on my keychain even with a lot of keys. It looks durable enough to be banging around with the keys on my keychain. Overall I highly recommend this little light. Everyone should have one of these!

UPDATE 11/2/2017:
This light makes an incredible hanging work light for working on my car in the dark. I have this light on my keychain with a carabineer and it hangs perfectly from my hood. It provided more than enough light for a quick fix in an emergency.

UPDATE 2/5/2018:
My nitecore light had stopped working. It wouldn't charge and it wouldn't turn on no matter how long it was charged. I thought it was dead, so I opened it up, which was surprisingly easy for such a small device. Just 4 small screws and a small amount of glue on the internal circuit board. I found that the positive connection for the battery to the circuit board was broken off the board. I was able to solder it back and it has worked for about 2 weeks with no issues. If it still is a problem I'm sure I'll be able to get some sort of warranty service from Nitecore. If it breaks again I'll update the review.

reviews:
I've bought about 8 or 10 of the Nitecore Tube in various colors for my own use and as gifts to family. That should tell you what I think of them overall. It does occasionally turn on inside my pocket but not nearly as often as the Fenix UC01. I've used a Tube for about three years (since around the time they first came out) and my original purchase is still going strong. The only durability issue has been that the little rubber cover for the USB port got torn off. Lack of the port cover has not affected functionality.

The Tube is available in many colors and I've bought most of them. Female family members especially like the translucent magenta color, labeled as "pink". I think it's the most attractive color and would be fine for a man to carry too (hey, we're all beyond the grade school "pink is for girls" stuff). The translucent blue is my everyday keychain light and it's also nice. The translucent "olive" on the other hand looks an awful sickly greenish-yellow though of course it's a matter of taste. The clear (transparent) model is kinda cool in a techy sort of way. As for the solid colors: "Red", so-called, is actually orange with a hint of reddish tone -- the picture in the product description is a reasonably faithful rendition of the color. Blue is a little closer to a sky blue than true blue. Black is, well, black.

Functionally the infinitely variable brightness is very convenient. In case anyone is wondering the battery capacity is 80 mAh.
product_name: NiteCore Tube Keychain Light T Series 45 Lumen Multi Color Pocket Flashlight
rank:
#20,482 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement)
#216 in Handheld Flashlights

reviews:
I'm super picky about the size of my keyring. My requirement is that is must fit in the coin pocket of my jeans. I keep three house keys, a Swiss+Tech Utility key, and a now this little light. It all fits perfect.

The low setting is enough to move around the house if it's dark, especially if your eyes are night adjusted. The high setting is brighter than I thought it would be from something this small. It's plenty to light a room, see down a hallway or light a blacked out stairwell. The light is mostly flood with no real spot. When it's charging there is a tiny blue light that's visible, it goes off when fully charged. I love that I can top it off and know that it's completely charged, unlike my other coin cell key chain lights.

I tested the run time on high and got to about 50 minutes before I noticed a real drop in brightness. At about 60 minutes it had dimmed very noticeably but was still plenty to navigate a room. After 70 minutes it had really dimmed to just a lumen or two but was still usable to navigate indoors. It was probably the equivalent of it's low setting. I stopped testing after that so as not to completely drain the battery since Lithium Ions don't like to be completely discharged.

I paid $11.99 for it in Dec '14 with Prime. I noticed the price has gone up a little. I hope they keep low, especially considering there is no charging cord included (make sure you have a micro USB cable). Even so, it's amazing how far LED flashlights have come in the last few years.

reviews:
User Note: It died within 10 minutes after removing it from package and we thought we'd have to return it. Was still unresponsive after a full charge (there's a tiny blue-hued indicator light while plugged into charger). But then we fiddled with the button once more, since there was nothing to lose... and after keeping it depressed a few seconds the light began working as usual again.
It's tiny and 1 Lumen is bright enough to see inside your sleeping bag without disturbing others while camped, or a dead-of-night trip to the loo as a hotel guest. 45 Lumens is plenty bright -- possibly too bright -- for rummaging in a bag or glovebox as passenger in a vehicle at night. Extremely handy little rechargeable light. Approx 48 hrs @ 1Lumen and 1hr @ 45Lumen per full charge (no clue how long that remains true over time and charges).

review_title: NiteCore Tube Keychain Light T Series with 45 Lumens Review
reviews:
This is a review of the Nitecore Tube Keychain Light T Series with a 45 lumen output. In short, I think this is a great light that has taken a huge step forward in functionality from other keychain lights. I highly recommend this light, especially to those who already use a Micro USB to charge their phone.

Though the concept of a tiny, lightweight flashlight to attach to your keys is a great idea, I normally have stayed away from those. The 1st and main reason is that the batteries for those things are not rechargeable, and you have to go looking for a specific watch-type of battery that is not readily available such as AA or AAA batteries. This Nitecore Tube Keychain Light has fortunately resolved this shortcoming by providing a rechargeable product that uses a Micro USB connector, similar to what you will use for most Android phones. 2nd, most of the keychain lights are not that bright, though I have found a couple that were. Not only does Nitecore provide one of the brightest at 45 lumens, there are two settings (there is a button to click once for low and twice for high), and low mode is an adjustable brightness setting (via a press and hold of the button on low-mode).

Positives:
1. Bright flood style light!
2. Provides a wide area of light, not narrow as some other lights.
3. Simple function using a single button, easy access for two modes, and the low-mode has an adjustable brightness setting.
4. Rechargeable!
5. Uses a Micro USB connector to charge the battery, which is what many people use to charge their Android and other phones!
6. Small form factor.
7. Extremely light weight (0.34oz or 9.6g with battery), compared the Fenix E05 AAA light with aluminum construction (0.44oz or 12.5g without battery).
8. Water resistant seals.
9. Durable within the past couple of months of daily carry with keys in my pocket.
10. The charge indicator LED light in blue is functionally beautiful as it alerts you that the light is connected to power and charging.

Negatives:
1. I wish it were waterproof to IPX-8 standards of submersible for 30 minutes, but this is more of a wish than a negative. I go swimming and fishing often and would not have to worry if this had more protection.
2. The bright, wide angle light is so broad that it can provide some glare in your own field of view at certain angles.

Note: I have not tested the runtime of this light and will reserve comment on that aspect.

Overall, I rate the NiteCore Tube Keychain Light T Series with 45 lumens a very solid 4.8 out of 5.0. The only ways I can imagine improving this light is to make it meet IPX-8 standards so it is submersible and to design it to produce less glare (if it is possible as this may interfere with the light's ergonomics). I highly recommend this light and have already purchased three of these. I prefer the looks of the clear.

UPDATE July 30, 2016:
Attached are some additional pictures comparing the NiteCore Tube Keychain Light in Black rated at 45 lumens vs the Olight i3E AAA Flashlight in Black rated at 90 lumens. The beam shots are with the Olight on the left and the NiteCore on the right. The Olight is slightly heavier, though both are extremely lightweight, and noticeably brighter. Included are pictures of the glare that you get from the side view, which can be a bit blinding. The NiteCore Tube is still a revolutionary light due to being rechargeable via a Micro USB connection. I just prefer a Olight due to being so light in weight and bright despite using a AAA Eneloop battery, and being waterproof.

reviews:
Good light for your keys for under $10.

We actually had a gift swap for Christmas at work this year with a $10 limit, so I decided to give this a shot for a female coworker. Pink seemed like the most obvious color choice so I went ahead and ordered.

Fast forward to our gift exchange, she opens it up and stares at it and says "What is this?". I guess she didn't like it. Even though the gift didn't go over well, here's some of the highlights of the Nitecore Tube that she will be missing out on:

For less than $10 it pays for itself quickly with its internal battery and USB charging. No more weird button batteries to buy. Just plug it in and your done.

One button switch for easy controls - just one press for low, 2 for high. You can lock out the light so it doesn't accidentally turn out and also choose the light level by being able to "ramp" it from 1 to 45 lumems.

It's tiny and weighs next to nothing so it really doesn't add much bulk to your keys either.

So overall, it's a pretty handy light to have on hand. 45 max lumens is not super bright but sufficient in a pinch. Definitely recommended for (almost) anyone as a practical tool to have with you at all times.

review_title: Almost a perfect keychain light but durability is certainly questionable...
reviews:
Pros: Compact and lightweight, rechargable, low and high lighting option, lockout mode
Cons: Durability

I bought this light 6 months ago and was pleased with it as my keychain light up until a week ago. The light would not turn on. At first, I thought that the battery might have been depleated since it's accidentally turned on in my pocket before. However, there's a lockout mode option that can be enabled help prevent this from happening. I placed it on the charger and the blue light came on as usual indicating that it was charging. The next morning I noticed that the blue light was still on, so I unplugged it and tested the light, no illumination. I emailed the manufacturer for support stating that the light would not turn on and that the device was NOT in lockout mode. I received a response a day later asking if lock out mode was enabled, charged, and if Ive tried contacting the seller. This irritated me a bit as I already provided this information in my initial email. After replying I was provided instructions on how to return the product to China for repair or replacement.
I purchased this light for less than 10.00 and it wouldn't be worth my time and effort.

I disassembled the light and noticed that the red wire was disconnected. I used my soldering iron and reattached the wire, issue resolved. The charging indicator now turns off when fully charged and the light is back to normal functionality.

In reading the reviews here it appears to be a common problem after several months of use. I wouldn't depend on this as a primary lighting souce as durability is questionable.

The price, form factor, brightness, and functions tick all the boxes for a EDC keychain light but the durability might leave you in the dark.

reviews:
I was looking for a keychain flashlight that was as small and light as possible while still being good quality, bright, and not causing *too* many battery hassles. Most of the choices out there are either:

- Far to big to *really* be "keychain" flashlights
- Not actually very bright
- Cheap (i.e. don't have a switch but screw/unscrew the battery compartment for on/off)
- Use batteries that will be an absolute pain to replace

This flashlight, on the other hand is:

- Very small, about the size of a key, very light and flat
- Blessed with an actual on/off switch
- Very, very bright in the "bright" mode
- Rechargeable with a standard micro-USB cable, so you don't need to find odd batteries

In short, it's basically the *ideal* "emergency keychain flashlight" and it's worth picking up a few of them IMO.

Great product.

reviews: I was using a AAA flashlight and lost it in the snow, so I bought this one. A big upgrade. It takes up less real estate in my pocket, so that is great right there. It also has two different brightnesses, which is helpful. If I'm using the light during the day (like trying to look under my truck's air cleaner to see if I can find a loose vacuum line), it's nice to have that extra punch. I tried pocketing the flashlight and it turned on and drained the battery the second day. Since I've been using the lockout feature, it has not once turned on. I always have light when I need it. Being able to charge it via USB is also nice. Not a great feature, but icing on the cake. Highly recommend this light.

review_title: Incredible value for an awesome little light
reviews:
I've been using the Tube for a few weeks now and it's already one of the most important things that I carry on myself everyday. I used to carry a small Photon Microlight on my keychain (5 years) but it just wasn't bright enough and I hated the process of needing to unscrew the little light to change out the batteries every few months. I replaced the Photon with the Tube and haven't looked back since. I primarily use the 45 lumen option on the light and it does last a legit 1 hour but it dims to a lower lumen output around 50 minutes based on my tests. However, it's so easy to charge and you can buy the cable separately on amazon for pretty cheap if you don't already have 3 of them sitting around the house. I'm planning on buying these as stocking stuffers for the holidays because they are cheap and awesome. It probably can't replace a much bigger flashlight if you're used to carrying one but for my needs and where I live the Tube is perfect. I'll always have the light on me and won't have to drain my iPhone battery trying to light something up.

If my opinion on the light changes in the next few months I'll be sure to update my review but for now 5 stars.

review_title: The best little pocket or keychain flashlight hands down and I have tried many!
reviews:
The best little pocket or keychain hands down. I have owned many small flashlights and this is by far the best design and battery option out there without a doubt! The best part is two things one its a "FLAT" small flashlight which is a godsend as we all know most keychain small flashlights are always ROUND and bulky and a pain to keep in a pocket this one is flat and you don't even notice it in a pocket in the least. The second is the fact I don't have to buy anymore batteries!!! I can recharge this flashlights batteries just about anywhere! I can charge it in the car or near a computer or the wall outlet! whoo hoo! I even used this thing in a kids summer camp for a week as my main flashlight charging it via a Anko Solar panel USB charger! Talk about charging anywhere! When you plug it into a USB micro cable it lights up with a blue L.E.D. indicator which goes out when its completely charged (See my photos) The charging port is located on the side. This is really great because just about anyone has a Micro USB cable charger for their phone or other devices and if not you just carry a short little USB micro cable with you to charge it.
This little sucker is BRIGHT! for 45 lumens its extremely bright by that 45 lumens standards to me its more like 80 lumens in my opinion. The button is located in a good location that is in the right spot when your holding the flashlight naturally in the hand. The button also has a great DIMMER feature that goes from 2 lumens to start off with to sliding up to the full brightness of 45 lumens by holding it down when you switch it on. It can be stopped at any brightness in between from 2 lumens to 45 lumens which to me is incredible feature for such a tiny flashlight. The battery charges really fast maybe 45 min to a hour from completely dead. The battery life is really fantastic for such a small flashlight as well. I only had to charge it 1 time when I was at camp for a whole week using it as a main flashlight instead of headlamp. Its so convenient to use because its so small and light weight. To me a flashlight is only good to you if you have it on you if you don't have it on you its useless. Being this small of a flashlight and as bright as it is you can use this thing for about 90% of the flashlight jobs you need one for. Unless you need a SEARCH and RESCUE Spot light or out gator hunting in the swamp at night this flashlight will do just about fine for any job. Since I had it for the last 4 months my other flashlights are collecting dust. You would be stupid not to buy this flashlight for the price a mere 10 bucks! Its built solid too does not feel cheap at all. The key ring holder it comes with is made to hold 75lbs before it breaks so no worries of loosing your keychain flashlight like so many other keychain lights. I recommend this thing for anyone wanting a great stocking stuffer or birthday present for any man in your life. They will love you for it and I mean any man even a Hypster urbanite to a hunter outdoorsmen anyone in between will love this light.

review_title: A good light if you're handy with a soldering iron.
reviews:
Unfortunately, I've had to change my review from a 5 star review to a 2 star review. The short answer is: I bought two of these lights and had to fix both of them with the same problem. I really like the flashlight, but I cannot recommend it to anyone in good conscience. It is just too fragile for its intended purpose. Keys get thrown around a lot and the light just cannot handle it.
The long answer: I bought one light for myself and one for my mother. Both attached to our respective car keys. Both stopped working in 6 months! You would give it a tappy-tap-tap and it would work for a little while, then stop working. Eventually it will stop working. You can plug it in and it acts like it's charging but it's not. One of the wires has come off of the battery pack. I was able to fix both of them (for the time being) but it's kind of a pain-in-the-ass.
To fix the broken wire, take off the back of light by removing the 4 screws. You should see that one of the wires has come loose. Originally, the wires are soldered to the bottom side of the circuit board (which is inaccessible) but I was able to solder the wire back on to the top side of the board.
Really, I can't see most consumers bothering with this, and they shouldn't need to, frankly. Somebody could make a buck buying broken NiteCore Tubes for $1, fixing them and then selling them for $5

The light is adjustable, low, high and custom brightness by keep pressing the power botton to your desired brightness. I'm carrying it in my pocket all the time and charged only once since buying it. I used it at work and for dog walks for about 2 months now and the battery is still good.
To give you an idea of the brightness my Galaxy S7 Edge has the brightest light I've seen on a phone so far and this little light is even brighter, at least 20% brighter. The light color is cool white. I wish it was a bit warmer.

I also have the Nitecore Tip. It's fatter, way brighter but the light is a bit warmer which is nice.

The only thing I would change is plastic botton instead of rubber. I believe rubber buttons will get worn out at some point carrying in a pocket or a purse. Nonetheless, a great light.

review_title: The Best Rechargeable Keychain Flashlight On The Market
reviews: This is one excellent keychain light! Rechargeable, tough, small, has a huge selection of modes, and like all Nitecore flashlights I own, it is ahead of the competition. For ten bucks, get one for yourself, friends and family members. It has a huge selection of modes but is intuitive and easy to use. The low light mode is very nice for using in the dark and not waking anyone up, as a candle or navigating for a short bit or checking maps. The bright mode is bright enough to survive in the wilderness with as long as you have a charge and is definitely very bright for this little light to get you where you need to. I'd say its more like 60 lumens.The multi-dimmer mode is nice if you want to hang it from the top of your tent as a candle, while adjusting the brightness level to something thats comfortable, covering any level between 1 lumen and 45 lumens. And the "hold for bright mode" is nice for a quick usage to find something in the car, quick spotting or anything like that. The flashlight hooks to a mini USB, and displays a blue light until fully charged and takes about an hour to reach full battery. So, again, I am surprised and impressed with my third Nitecore and recommend it for anyone. This little light will make your life easier. Get one. You won't be disappointed!

reviews:

When on low press and hold to ramp up to 45 lumens. Charging doesn't take too long, take it off Keychain plug it in and before long its fully charged.

Bought a second one for work. Clipped it to the lanyard behind my badge. Hardly ever noticed it there. Great for looking in and under machines. If I need both hands I can just bite down on it. And because it's thin and made out of plastic. Its not awkward like with a cylinder type.

reviews:
I love this little light! Its 45 lumen output is very bright for its size and it has a 1-hour run time at the brightest setting. It also has a moonlight mode (1 lumen) and there's an "infinite variable brightness" setting in between, although in reality it jumps in steps of about 5 lumens. The control system is pretty easy if you read the instructions on the packaging. I think the clear option (vs. the colored cases) is the best choice because you get a little extra light from the glow of the body.

Recharging is easy - you need a micro-USB cable (different than the more-common mini-USB) which is not included. You probably have one lying around somewhere but if not, they're cheap to buy. Just hook it up to any USB socket and watch for the charging indicator light to go out.

When I opened my flashlight I noticed it had a Chinese factory worker's hair entombed inside the case by the battery. I decided to try and open it using a tiny Philips screwdriver to open the four screws, but I failed because the screws are pretty soft and are very easy to strip. I somehow managed to completely strip two of the four screws (to the point where the head is completely smooth) so I can never open the case now. Take this as a warning not to try and open the case - or if you do, be very careful. I have a light with a hair inside and stripped screws, one of which sticks out a little because I couldn't get it back in, and yet I still love this light!

The battery is NOT designed to be user-replaceable, but I consider this a non-issue given the fact that it should last a VERY long time and the light is so inexpensive to begin with. In theory, you could replace the battery if you can source the same tiny li-ion battery, but you'd have to de-solder the old battery and solder the new one onto the board.

This is the best keychain light I have ever seen and I will be buying more to keep around the house/car.

review_title: Everything a keychain light should be
reviews:
If you don't have a keychain flashlight, get the NightCore Tube. It's inexpensive, unreasonably bright for something with such a small battery, has an intuitive user interface, doesn't need coin cells that cost a couple of bucks retail, and recharges with a micro-USB connector that you probably have a cable and charger for. Unlike using your phone, the Tube is something you won't mind lending to a friend, will probably survive being dropped without missing a beat, and generally works better as a flashlight.

I put a tube on my keychain and find it useful on an almost daily basis. Get home late, use it to check the depths of the mailbox. Walking into a dark house, use it to avoid colliding with obstacles and household pets. Used it as my sole light source to repair a friend's broken trunk latch on short notice.

Some will rightly complain about the glare that the tip of the LED sends back into your face; I find that holding it such that my thumb blocks that glare is a 90% satisfactory solution to the problem that's free. The light quality is nothing to write epics about - it's a very cool white with little definition to the beam ... but it's also an inexpensive and very unobtrusive flashlight.

review_title: lightweight and with surprising battery life
reviews:
Update after 12 months: I love this light. How did I live so long without it? And how did I not know there was a lockout setting till today?

I've had this little light for 3 months and used it almost every night searching for dog poop (from my dog! My neighborhood is dark). The lower light isn't useful for that much, but the brighter one is good for my purposes. I've used the light for looking for stuff in my car, seeing all the nooks when putting furniture together, and more. I have the light on my keys and take them everywhere. A few times I've found that the light had turned on in my pocket.

I was worried the battery life would be crap, but it was only 3 days ago I noticed the light was really weak so I recharged the light for the first time ever. It was a snap and afterwards it's as bright as the day it arrived. I know I don't use the light for very long at a time, but 3 months even with my light usage is impressive!

I had worried I'd hate the extra bulk on my keychain, and I do--but not as much as I'd thought. It's very small and lightweight. My car key is far worse.

review_title: Extremely good bedside light for the cost.
reviews:
Perfect size for a bedside flashlight
I use when I have to get up in the middle of the night. My wife liked it so much she asked for one of her own.
Advantages
1) Extremely good for the price.
2) Rechargeable, and uses a standard micro USB cord (not included), so you do not need to buy a separate charger.
3) Reasonable selection of light outputs: 1 lumen or 45 lumens with a single or double click, or variable 1-45 lumens by clicking then clicking and holding.

Three minor downsides to be aware of:
1) If you put it in your pocket, the side switch is easily activated. I do not consider this to be a pocket flashlight.
2) The light beam is very broad and shines back in your eyes a bit.
3) Although it is rated to be watertight, the flap covering the USB port is not very secure. In my mind it is not watertight. This is not a problem, but it is good to know this in advance.

Alternative Lights: Fenix has just come out with a similar light, the Fenix UC01, which costs a couple of dollars more. I have bought many Fenix lights and love them, but I have not tried this particular light.

Charging again produces the same behavior, charge light comes on for a few minutes, but then goes off and the light doesn't work.

Considering it's under $10 it's still cheaper than the coin cell batteries I would have burned through in a year for a normal keychain light turning itself on, but given that this product has the Nitecore branding on it I'm very disappointed in the quality, as this product just doesn't hold up long-term at all.

review_title: Near perfect keychain light that is bright enough to be your only EDC light.
reviews: Super lightweight and easy to carry. Very bright for the size. The high output is more than enough for most tasks, though it is lacking in range since there is no reflector. But this is about as heavy as a house key and it wasn't long ago that 45 lumens was considered very impressive for a full sized flashlight. The moonlight setting is great for up close tasks or not disturbing others. I was worried the USB cover wouldn't hold up and that the light would accidentally turn on in my pocket. After a few months the USB cover is good as new and it has turned on in my pocket only a few times. Only complaint: I wish it had a medium setting of about 15-20 lumens so you can get enough light for most tasks and conserve battery life. The infinitely variable brightness mode is not a replacement for a medium setting since you can't quickly set it and you don't know what battery life to expect.

review_title: Great light, wish they held up better
reviews:
Love it. I used to have Photon Microlights on my keychains, but using coin batteries always bother me a bit, as replacements are a pain and somewhat pricey. I have never really wanted a AAA light hanging off my keychain, since I have enough crap on there as it is. Runs for a rather impressive 1 hour at 45 lumens, 48 hours at the lowest (1 lumen) setting. It has a relatively simple interface, and I really really like the press-and-hold for momentary high option.

Like:
- 45 lumen high for 1 hour
- Variable Output
- Rechargable
- Very slim, weighs almost nothing
- 2 attachment ring sizes come with it to attach to your keyring

No Like:
- Possibility of water getting in thru the charging port, but I mean, it's a keychain light. Minor gripe.

I think it's one of the best keychain lights, and priced really well considering the specs. And who doesn't have an extra Mirco USB charging cable around? You can always borrow one at an airport, the office, etc. if you run out of juice.

EDIT 2017.12.26
I've broken about 3 of these now, and I'll have to switch to something else. In one instance I took the case apart and re-soldered a wire that had come loose connecting the hot lead of the battery to the board. I felt very accomplished, until it stopped working again. Changed from 5 stars to 3.

reviews:
For its size and price, the Nitecore Tube is a major leap in keychain light capabilities compared to anything that came before. It produces a smooth, wide beam that illuminates a large area, and the color quality is decent, without any nasty purple or green tint. I like the user interface which allows quick access to low or high mode, depending on the situation. On maximum output, it reaches about 100cd in brightness. That's slightly less than a Streamlight Nano or a Photon Freedom on fresh batteries, but it maintains relatively constant brightness for about 45-50 minutes, unlike those other lights which start declining in output almost immediately. I also like that it's rechargeable by a common USB cable, so no need to buy replacement batteries or lug around proprietary cables.

The one area where it could use improvement is unwanted glare coming up from the LED. Make the LED recessed, so it doesn't throw glare in my eyes. Otherwise, for 10 dollars it's a very good light.

review_title: Didn't even cycle through all the modes before it died
reviews:
Taking the blister pack out of the shipping box, one of the rings dropped out and disappeared between the arm and seat cushion of my chair. The package was not sealed and shows no sign of ever having been glued or stapled shut.

I got the low level light to stay on (which is very dim), but the thing failed a few seconds after getting to the high level beam. (The high beam provides excellent illumination, though.) I thought the battery might be dead, so I charged it (blue light came on, a while later went off) but I could never get the light to come on again. Because there was an overwhelming number of positive reviews, I had hoped for the best. But apparently the manufacturer has quality control issues.

One note for people with weak hands: it does take a bit of strength/pressure to push down on the power button and hold it. I'm going to look for a small light that you press once and it stays on until you press the power switch again.

review_title: Lighten your load, brighten your night, charge on the go.
reviews: This little key chain light is awsome. Light as a feather, fits anywhere, bright as hell (for its size). I attached it to a simple paracord and keep it on my keys, on my leatherman surge, or hang it from my belt loop. This nite core tube is so light that the paracord attached to it is heavier than it is. I love that I can charge it with my phone's micro usb while I'm driving. It can fully charge in one 30-60min drive and I only plug it in about once a week or so. The functions are very practical: one click dim, double click bright, and (the most used feature) long press for instant bright mode until you release the power button. For the price, there is no reason not to get a few of these; and if you want to get all fancy you can wrap it in para, hang a bead from it, etc... Make it a part of your edc that you will actually use without weighing you down.

reviews:
What a fantastic little light!

I'm a bit of an LED flashlight junkie - I'm going on about 50 - and this is hands-down my favorite!

1) I'm pitifully night blind and this thing (these things, actually, I own five, carry two, and have given a few away as gifts) kept me from stubbing toes or tripping my way through campsites. The built in battery/charger is switch and there's more than enough light or burn time depending upon the setting.

2) the size is perfect and the shape/plastic are unique so there's never an issue finding it in my pocket. I had a ThorFire little pencil that worked well but after the eighth or ninth time it worked its way out of my pocket I gave up on it.

3) the infinitely variable brightness is super-handy once you get the hang of it. It's fantastic for task lighting when you're not expecting to perform a task. And the best flashlight is always whichever one is on you when you need it!

review_title: Decent keychain light, somewhat questionable build quality.
reviews:
It's cheap. It's sufficiently bright for it's size and battery life is good when run at normal brightness.
I got it for my wife to use on her keychain.

This light just recently stopped working.
Upon opening it up, I noted that the very small negative lead had become unsoldered from the IC board.
I was able to re-solder the lead and secure the board back on the posts and close it up.

I did note that one screw came already stripped out. I believe either this had been opened up previously or the build quality is simply not on par with Nitecore's other offerings.

Were it not for the build quality, I think that this would get 5 stars.
For it's use-case, it is bright enough, small enough, cheap enough, and easy to charge.

reviews:
Wow this thing is bright. At first when I powered it on I thought; "how disappointing and typical of keychain flashlight." After I clicked it a 2nd time it was blinding bright.

I recommend this, and for the price, it's a great EDC to keep on your keys.

review_title: This is a great utility light so far
reviews: I've only had this a short time, it has replaced 2 Fenix LD keychain lights that have failed over the last couple years. This is a great utility light so far, it is mostly flood with very little throw, which is what this type of light should be. The problem with twist-on type keychain lights like the Fenix LD series is that the friction from turning on/off wears away the thin copper contact so they inevitably fail. Time will tell with this one regarding durability but the design seems great. I keep my keys in my pocket and I have not had this light accidentally turn on yet. This is also smaller and much lighter than single AAA battery lights, so less wear and tear on the ignition when used on a keychain.

review_title: Great light, the high setting makes this stand out ...
reviews:
Great light, the high setting makes this stand out in a good way heads and tails above any other keychain light I have owned or seen and the low setting is fine for a quick peek at something. The construction appears solid and the recharge port has a plug. It is like having a full sized flashlight from 20 years ago in your pocket at all times and is as good as many small flashlights at 10 feet or less (the beam is not focused).

I havent had to recharge it yet. It came fully charged and worked right out of the box. I will update thia review if any problems arrive but as of now I could not be more pleased with this product.

If you work nights or evenings like me in a low light environment you will be extremely happy with this light.

review_title: Simple Mod makes this a 5 star EDC light
reviews: This is my first intentionally purchased EDC flashlight, and it has served me as well as its many, many positive reviews would suggest. I wasn't sure that I had much to say that others hadn't already--great value, strong light, excellent battery life--EXCEPT for a quick DIY fix to the light bleed problem. As others have noted, the exposed LED bulb tends to hit your eye pretty hard if you go to full power from dusk or full darkness. My solution was simply to crazy glue a small piece of non-descript black leather over the space between the "prongs" that shield the bulb on the left and right. It was a 2 minute operation, and the light is now, in terms of function, exactly what I would have liked it to be out of the package. NiteCore could easily mod their mold to feature a similar low-light-vision protecting design.

review_title: A keychain flashlight for anybody that hates keychain flashlights (and batteries)
reviews: I hate keychain flashlights. I hate that you almost always have to twist them instead of clicking. I hate that they're not very bright. review_title: Doesn't get better in a key-chain light.
reviews: I don't know why no other company has done this before. A convenient tiny key-chain light with a li-ion rechargeable battery that uses the extremely common micro-USB cord to recharge. I have been very impressed with the output of this light, the "beam" is very floody and doesn't through much farther than about 25~30 feet. Indoors it can light up a medium sized room or a small hallway adequately. In terms of size I was expecting it to be about the size of the remote to my car, but it's even smaller than that by a very noticeable amount and didn't add much bulk to my key-chain. All-in-all this is the best light of its size that I know of, and for the price it's well worth it and can make a good gift you could get for multiple people.

review_title: Lasted 3 months before it stopped working
reviews:
Latest update:
Took the non-working flashlight apart and noticed one of the wires was no longer connected. Soldered it back on and the light works again. This is a flaw in the design and quality control of these flashlights but it was easily repaired and the light is now working again. Not adding any more stars to my review, customer should not have to perform repairs like this.

Revised review:
After having this flashlight 3 months, it has failed and will not turn on. The charging light indicates it is charging when plugged into USB cable but it will not turn on. I kept this on my keychain, it never got wet and it was not thrown around or handled roughly. There must be a defect in the one I got. It was great while it worked, but should last more than 3 months. Looking for the warranty info to see if I can get a replacement...

Original review:
I love this little flashlight. It is USB rechargeable, tiny and always there when I need it. The max brightness is sufficient for most needs. If I require a brighter light, I will use a full size flashlight or lantern.

reviews:
This is a very simple device so my review will be short.
Very light weight.
Perfect brightness: One click for getting the key in your door lock, two clicks for searching the yard for critters.
Very small, fits easily into any pocket.

Suggested improvements:
Add a bezel around the button. I've pulled it out of my pocket many times and noticed light was on because the button was pressed when I leaned on something. Now battery is dead. Annoyed.

Add a slight bezel around the bulb. I have to hold my thumb over the edge of bulb to keep from blinding myself.

Add a battery or install a slightly larger one in this thing. Adding the slight extra cost, weight and mm in size would be well worth the extra usage time.
