review_title: The BEST Keychain Light for Every Day Carry
reviews:
Every once in a while a product comes along that changes the playing field for a particular niche. The NiteCore Tube is one of those products. It's about half an inch longer than the squeezy micro LED lights, and a couple of grams heavier. And it blows the squeezy lights away - even the new LRI Photon Freedom light that has been part of my Every Day Carry (EDC). Here's why:

1. Brighter - Yeah, it's bright. That's what happens when you use a rechargeable lithium battery that can belt out many times the current of lithium coin cells. I'd say it's as bright as the Photon's bright spot, but over a much larger area. If I wanted the same amount of light the Tube puts out using Photons, I'd need at least 10 of them. It's about the same brightness and beam pattern as the flash on my Note 3 phone. Chromatically, the Tube's light is like a florescent lamp. It's white, not yellow, nor blue.

2. Rechargeable - I'm one of those people who grudgingly use devices with non-rechargeable batteries because I worry that when I really need them, I'll have half-dead batteries. No worries now! The light charges in less than 30 minutes from my phone charger.

3. I'll keep the light on for ya - for 48 HOURS on low. I like low. It's bright enough to walk around the house in the middle of the night yet dim enough to avoid the sleep-altering effect of turning on bright lights. It's great for reading in bed without disturbing the little lady. And for when you need it, the 40 minutes of 45 lumen high beam is nothing short of awesome coming from a tiny light like this.

Now the Tube does have a few flaws:

1. It's not waterproof. The light is constructed of two polycarbonate plastic halves that are held together by four screws. There's no gasket between the halves, so water is free to flow into the case. I suppose a judicious application of silicone caulk could make it water-resistant, but it still has a USB charging port. Maybe the Tube v2.0 will have an inductive charger so it can be waterproof. Until then, I would treat it as you do your cell phone. A few splashes won't hurt, but don't take it for a swim.

2. Because the click switch is on the flat side of the light, it can turn on if you carry it in your pocket and lean up against something. A quick-witted friend asked if I was flashing him. I thought he meant my zipper was down, but it was the light on low in my windbreaker's pocket.

Since I received the Tube, it has replaced the Photon as one of my two EDC lights. I still carry the Thrunit Archer 1C for when 500 lumens is necessary, but the Tube has become my go-to light when a light is needed. Its combination of small size, extremely light weight, durability, high light output, wide beam, and rechargeability make it a five-star performer.
product_name: NiteCore Tube Keychain Light T Series 45 Lumen Multi Color Pocket Flashlight
rank:
#20,482 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement)

reviews: I bought two of these as stocking stuffers, one of the stockings being my own. This device is designed very well, and its being USB-rechargeable is a good deal. Keychain lights are often irritating because changing their batteries requires removing tiny screws whose slots deform too easily. No more problems like that with the "Tube". At first I thought that the low setting -- one lumen -- would be inadequate. But I found that in a dark room, especially once your eyes become dark-adapted, the low setting provides plenty enough illumination, even if you bounce the light off a low ceiling. The variable-illumination feature is pretty useful too (press the button twice, then hold it down immediately after the second press).
product_name: NiteCore Tube Keychain Light T Series 45 Lumen Multi Color Pocket Flashlight
rank:

reviews:
After about of 2 weeks of barely using it (2 charge cycles) it strobes randomly when in the high beam mode.

Low power works fine, you can raise the level to about 80%, then it starts cutting out, producing a really disturbing random blinking strobe effect.

Didn't get wet, wasn't left on, was on my key ring and probably used it less than a couple of times (find a screw I dropped, or getting through kids' room without waking them up .....

My old photon light worked for 5 years and went through hell, I was hoping this would work for some time.
I guess I was wrong.

Frankly, for $9 I don't even want to start a refund process as it would cost more to send it back.

I really hope that the P12 and the 2 headlamps I ordered from Nitecore are not of the same quality as this :(

reviews: Wide angle light, I had the Streamlight Nano before this, and it was a great micro light, until I started using this one. Very easy interface, super slim profile, even thinner than the Nano. Fits on my key ring next to my Ford key fob, and just disappears in my pocket. The nice thing about the tough plastic body is that it does not scratch easily, and wont scratch anything else on my key ring. Very quick recharging and super bright and long life. The only thing I wish it had was a mini carabiner like the Nano. By far the best micro flashlight I have used or seen. A great addition to anyone's key ring.

review_title: Awesome product! Or so I thought!
reviews:
Quit after 34 days. Still charges, blue led comes on then off when charged. But bulb is gone bad. Great idea rechargeable light, bad components or circuit design, so I thought. I emailed seller for refund. They responded within hours. It has a protection circuit. After fully charged, press for 8-10 seconds. Excellent product! Excellent customer service!
UPDATE: Now 1 month later it won't accept a charge, won't come on. Zero reply to my email after 2 days. Blue led light comes on while charging, but won't go off to show it is charged, and won't come on. It has a complicated circuit that shuts down to prevent accidental activation, but who needs that? There is something wrong with the design of this product. Maybe a poor battery?

reviews: I had high hopes for this light. Rechargeable? Great! Small size, bright light? Great! BUT! There is something frail about the circuitry. I bought two. Less than a year later, the small light that tells you it is charging works, but the actual light for use no longer does. Is it charging for real or just a charge light that comes on? I don't know. Is the main LED broken? I don't know. Is there a break in the wiring? I don't know. I do know that in less than one year, neither work anymore! My chip key and my remote for my car and other items on my keyring aren't broken, but both lights failed! I highly recommend AGAINST this light. Great idea, but something wrong with the design inside. Bad solder? Fragile wire? Either way, not reliable.

reviews:
I ordered 2 of these lights back in March. One is dead already and will not charge. They have a little rubber cover for the USB charging port, the cover has already torn off the one still working. My biggest gripe is that the on/off button gets pushed by the keys when the light is in my pocket so when I actually need it, it doesn't have a charge. Maybe if you carry this in a purse it will work, but if you carry it in a pocket it turns on too easily.
Pity, because it actually does provide a bright, clear light when it is working. I will not be buying another one and can't recommend it.

review_title: Great light..until I needed to charge it
reviews: I bought this light off the recommendation of a friend and was really excited to have a key-chain adjustable light. It didn't come with its own charging cable though. I would have returned it immediately if i didn't have extra cables lying around because come on really? no cable for a rechargeable device? Besides that It worked flawlessly until i needed to charge it. i plugged it in. the blue light came on...and that was it. the light never changed color o turned off or blinked or anything. So i figured maybe it was my cable. I swapped cables and now the light wont even turn on. my advice is to look elsewhere for a rechargeable device unless you have ten bucks to throw away because the light itself is actually pretty decent if it would come with a way to recharge it. who knows . maybe i just got a bad item.

reviews:
Lasted about 6 months. Won't take a charge, won't turn on.

If I had to guess, I'd say that there's no over-discharge protection circuit, and it got switched on in my pocket. I've noticed it being on before, and I guess I had switched it off before it was a problem.

If you're going to design a product with a fragile battery technology, you need to have protection for the battery.
